pageContext.title: Reading, Rereading, Recovering Electronic Literature
pageContext.description:
Please join us for a panel with [Joanne Archer](http://lib.guides.umd.edu/profile.php?uid=26492) (University of Maryland Libraries), [Jeremy Douglass](http://jeremydouglass.com/) (UC Santa Barbara), [Dene Grigar](http://www.nouspace.net/dene/Webpages/Home.html) (Washington State University Vancouver), [Kari Kraus](http://www.karikraus.com/) (University of Maryland), [Stuart Moulthrop](http://www4.uwm.edu/letsci/english/people/faculty/moulthrop.cfm) (University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee), and [Matthew Kirschenbaum](http://mkirschenbaum.wordpress.com/) (MITH/University of Maryland, moderator).
And a reading from **_[We Descend](http://www.wedescend.com/)_**, by hypertext fiction by Bill Bly (to begin at 4:30pm).
_We Descend_, “a story of our far future, unearthed by a scholar to whom it is the distant past,” was originally published on computer disk by Eastgate Systems in 1997. More information, as well as a continuation of the work, [is available here](http://www.wedescend.com/).
Free and open to the public.
